snippet: More than a dozen members of Moral Monday Georgia, a liberal activist group that has held weekly protests at the Capitol since January, were arrested.
abstract: Moral Monday movement, which began in North Carolina, takes firm root in Georgia, where arrests of liberal protestors at state Capitol are group’s boldest action since it began; similar protests have occurred in South Carolina, where smaller but persistent campaign of civil disobedience has played out for the third week in a row; movements are rare stirrings of impassioned, liberal political action in region where conservative control of government holds strong.
lead_paragraph: More than a dozen members of Moral Monday Georgia, a liberal activist group that has held weekly protests at the Capitol since January, were arrested.

headline.main: Budding Liberal Protest Movements Begin to Take Root in South
headline.print_headline: Budding Liberal Protest Movements Begin to Take Root in South
